website_summaries.verdict: For a traditional axe that works great in competition at a good price, this model is a good bet.
pros: Hand forged in a traditional method
Good size at 19-inch length on the handle
Approved by the National Muzzle Loading Rifle Association for competition
cons: Does not come with a sheath

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, junk made in India.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Cracks, bad welds, sloppy finish work and poorly fitted to the handle. The head is poorly welded to the eye with visible cracks along the top and bottom edges, the eye is just a piece of steel bent around the handle and sloppily welded together. The eye has gaps and welding splatter that was never cleaned up. The blued finish has blotches, swirls, and a visible weld on the side. It is junk made in India. Spend a little extra and get a truly hand forged hawk made in America. I got an email from the seller asking if I was satisfied, I replied telling them my disappointment and I never heard back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered three of the axes as a birthday gift ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of the axes as a birthday gift for someone that really likes primitive weapons. Two of the axes were received in usable shape. The third, however, had a separated weld two to three inches behind the cutting edge and could not be used at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The blade came off the handle (just like any axe will after lots of use)
customer_reviews.text: The friend I bought this for loves it. We had to have thrown it at least 100 times before we had any problems with it. The blade came off the handle (just like any axe will after lots of use). The owner intends to insert a pin through the metal and the handle. I'm trying to convince him to take one of the available replacement handles and carve it up for his wife in the style that might have been typical of the tribe of her heritage.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Turner, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for a cosplay thing
customer_reviews.text: My husband begged me to make him a viking cosplay costume and I thought I could maybe make an axe out of foam or something, but the cost of materials and time would have made that just not worth it when I could get this REAL one for about the same cost. I got it and did a few things to it to make it look "older". It's perfect. Feels great in the hand. Sadly, I do not have any chopping effectiveness data because it has not been used for that purpose yet, but we just moved out to our 3 acre property so I'm sure it will get some use soon.
customer_reviews.author: Incutheta

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented waist of money
customer_reviews.text: First thing i noticed was that the head rattled when i was taking off the poor wrapping the tomahawk came with. On closer inspection i can clearly see the welds between the eye and the head.. While inspection the axe head unexpectedly slid down the handle and hit me in the hand.. not fitted well at all. Im only happy about two things. 1. I didnt try throwing it prior to inspection. 2. It didnt come sharp enough to hurt me when it failed. Im writing this within 5 minutes of opening the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jwatty

customer_reviews.title: Seems alright.
customer_reviews.text: So, over all not completely displeased yet.... yet... haven’t gotten major use out of it yet other than a few tosses at a target in the back yard and it stuck more times than not. My major complaint is I’m about 98% sure I ordered the natural steel variant, and got the antiqued variant but I should be able to fix that. Overall the handle is straight, and the head seems a little heavy for the handle length but appears to fit on the handle tightly and cleanly shaped with no bad welds, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Splinters and rough finish on wood handle.
customer_reviews.text: I am dissatisfied with the craftsmanship. One of the wood handles is quite rough with splinters. I purchased two to give as a gift, and the intended recipient has the ability to sand the handle smooth, but I should not have to apologize or point out the defect of my gift. I purchased one of the same axes a year and a half ago, so out of the 3, I am unsatisfied with only one.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: Axe is not sharp
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I don’t know what I was expecting, but whatever it was did not arrive in the box. The head is loose. Don’t expect the edge to be honed, it is not. Don’t expect the head to be sharpened, it is not. Do expect to spend a couple of hours tightening the head and then sharpening and honing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moraller

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The tomahawk arrived on time and it looks and feels great. The grain in the hickory handle is straight as an arrow and the length is perfect. The head slipped onto the handle with a snug fit (no gaps at all), it looks very cool as well. The linseed finish of the handle is very nice. The tomahawk is exactly as advertised. I am very pleased with it. I would highly recommend this Throwing Viking Throwing Tomahawk.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: i wouldn't buy this thing again on a bet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most poorly made hatchet I have ever thrown. I am a competitive knife and hatchet thrower and the blade of this thing is so poorly built that it will not penetrate a wooden target at all. The balance is fair but it's inability to stick into a target is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Recieved the tomahawk and pulled it out of the box to discover large chips out of the blade. I understand it is for throwing, but nobody wants a pre chipped blade on something. Especially for the price tag. I should have just bought a SOG fasthawk or made my own so the poor craftsmanship is justified. EDIT After leaving this, I was quickly contacted and the seller is sending a second tomahawk head, and in my book that is pretty solid, especially because it is free of charge. Upgraded to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not a real axe
customer_reviews.text: Horrible axe. I guess this is display only. It’s clearly not an actual axe and not good for axe throwing al all. Axe head floats up and down the handle. Mine came with a blunt edge. I tried sharpening to no avail ...
customer_reviews.author: jjf88

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with these at all. The axe head will not stay in place. We ordered 2 and both heads fall down the handle every time you throw them. They were like this when they arrived too. The price vs quality is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi VanLandingham

customer_reviews.title: Be safe when using
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to get these but they are a great product. The handles are stained and fit nicely. My first hatchet from another supplier was crude and poorly fit handles had to be sanded to fit and was raw unfinished wood. These are a great add to the family’s backyard range
customer_reviews.author: Aaaa Aaaa

customer_reviews.title: great throwing hawk.
customer_reviews.text: Throwing axes is probably my favorite hobby. Axes of all sizes and types. I have This hawk as well as the beginner throwing hawk they sell(different width heads that make a different weight for throwing) and I love both of them. Ive broken a few handles but that comes with the territory.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Nice tomahawk to throw
customer_reviews.text: I got three of the polished steel version. Throws great. They came dull but seems like that was on purpose given folks may like that done a certain way. A file and stone handled that in fairly short order. Fit and finish of the handles on par with others tomahawks I’ve thrown. Eventually the handles do break and the axe head loosens but that is just part of it when teaching people to throw.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B Kinard

customer_reviews.title: Just No
customer_reviews.text: poor fit to haft. very dull. center of head is at 16.5" on a 19" handle. It'll take a couple hours but it's recoverable. Won't recommend. Regrettable purchase. Paid 40. worth 20. simple as that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: well built
customer_reviews.text: this is a strong axe and handle. i have been practicing so that i can challenge my stepson to a competition, but i am really bad at it. you can't hardly hurt the axe head, but the handle has taken a lot of abuse but still in great shape. I really enjoy trying to hit a target with it. maybe someday i will be good at it.
customer_reviews.author: ed davis

customer_reviews.title: Great looking THawk,
customer_reviews.text: **update, bought a new one, different sized handle, shifty welding on inside of eye, will work, with lots of work... Stuck on first toss. Overall a great little addition. Throws and sticks like butter. Only down side was the chip in the blade, upper 1/4 in just gone. Testing one other company out but very happy with this one so far, minus the chip....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged like me🤠
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional quality! This hawk was exactly what I was looking for! I had a few questions in the buying process and the customer service was excellent! bravo! Made for people who put their tools through the gauntlet.!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Starbuck

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely little throwing hawk! I have been working on it, getting the heavy paint like coating off the metal to expose the craft work that was laying hidden. The edge is clean and with a great profile. Next will be a coat of stain to set this little gem off and to match the rest of the edged clan!
customer_reviews.author: DWAYNE

customer_reviews.title: Not forge welded
customer_reviews.text: This is not forge welded. Mine still had a small bead from a electric welder on it. Weld seam runs all the way through. Time will tell but probably wont last. But for under 40 dollars I’ll the kids have fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: SouthMT

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is way more weighty than I expected. But man is this awesome. This is very well balanced and you can just tell it feels sturdy. My ONLY knock is that the wood handle is a tad rough and unfinished feeling, but that can easily be taken care of with some sand paper and polish. I am overall VERY happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jadon Scott Howard

customer_reviews.title: Looks good if you just want to hang it on the wall
customer_reviews.text: Like: The way it looks. Dislike: The axe head is not secured to the handle and becomes loose after throwing. You have to pound the axe up the handle to secure it enough to throw. However, since it is not actually fixed to the handle it will loosen on contact causing it to either barely stick or fall to the ground. Then you have to repeat the process of pounding the axe head up the hanle. I would not buy this product again. The only reason I gave it two stars over all is because it does look good and fuctional.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: ... for the handle was uneven and the edge was dull. This likely contributed to it failing to stick ...
customer_reviews.text: The socket for the handle was uneven and the edge was dull. This likely contributed to it failing to stick 9/10 times with a perfect blade impact. The only way to get it to stick was to fling it far harder than should be necessary. I've been throwing for 28 years, my other tomahawks were my control group (same weight/length) and they stuck easily while this one bounced right off of the block.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Heft

customer_reviews.title: my tomahawk arrived unsharpened and put together upside down by ...
customer_reviews.text: my tomahawk arrived unsharpened and put together upside down by some sort of press making it a pain in the ass to fix i personally wouldnt by from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: gus seeley

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my throwing hawk about a month ago and I am very pleased with it. I learned to throw when I was 14 from a fellow tomahawk thrower his name is Steve Haines and at the time he finished 2nd in the state of west Virginia and he is the one that taught me how to throw. For years I have stopped throwing because I wasn't sure where to get a good hawk at until I came across them on Amazon. I am going to get my 9 year old grandson into throwing and I am looking at the smaller ones for him to start learning...I would recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Weight and size not consistent But OK for backyard  but OK for backyard fun
customer_reviews.text: Weight and size not consistent I Purchased 2 of these for use in my backyard and just for the fun of throwing hatchets and for that these are fine. But I can’t imagine using these in competition as the advertisement states. 1. The width of the blades is different 2. The weight of one is 15.3oz. and the other 16.5oz. 3. The eyes are slightly different size causing one to slide farther up the handle than the other. Every time I throw them I’m thinking “this feels like the heavy one or vice a versa” ... probably not the best thing to have running through your head in a competition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Pure Crap! Do Not Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: "Made in India" steel axe is very crudely crafted with welding 'splatter' inside the head that makes it impossible for the 'Hickory Handle' to seat! The taper and shape of the 'Hickory Handle' does not match the inside diameter and shape of the axe-head. After removing 'welding-splatter' with files and Dremel-Drill grinders, 'Hickory-Handle' passed completely through Axe-Head. This product presents a lethal danger to anyone near a throwing target!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Teachey

customer_reviews.title: Poor tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: Not well balanced, not sharp at all, tomahawk and handle do not fit well leaving about 4 inches of the handle out above the tomahawk. Not impressed one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Chuckin' Hawks...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful construction. Weighted perfectly (for me at least) I could not be happier with this purchase. Then to top it all off, got an email from the company with some care tips and tricks to keep the hawk in its best condition. Very verily happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brother Sevin

customer_reviews.title: About average,  definately below average for the price, you can find much better for cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Alot lighter weight than expected & slightly smaller, good hickory handle & blued finish looks nice. Was completely dulled, no edge, had to be ground & sharpened
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Never resolved the issue that I have with the head ...
customer_reviews.text: Never resolved the issue that I have with the head of the axe almost coming off the handle. It is all the way at the top of the handle ready to come off after the first throw. The handle needs to be wider at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the bluing
customer_reviews.text: This tomahawk is exactly what I was hoping it would be. The steel is smooth and polished and the bluing creates a very unique look. I've not had the chance to throw it so I cannot comment on its functionality. The edge is rounded..... No edge. I don't mean dull, I mean no edge. Regardless, I think it's great, well worth the money and better than the cold steel Hawks. Better made, better balance and look.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dulls fast
customer_reviews.text: Dull within one hour of throwing on pine wood and will not stick in the target, not impressed for spending 40 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Adams

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what this professional guy in the reviews was talking about if he even is a professional , I thought this product is great and well made , very sturdy , perfect for throwing , very well made , good for camping or to cut some wood or just mess around with.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Build your own
customer_reviews.text: Head come loose after one time using it. Because head coming loose it chipped up the handle had replace handle. Axe head does not look like the picture shown
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: Handles great, weight and balance good! throwing from 15 and 25 yards, got my 2 daughters throwing with confidence now also!!
customer_reviews.author: Chahana

customer_reviews.title: For the money I’m not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these plus two extra handles. The two heads were delivered and one was “dry” and needed no cleaning. The other was completely soaked in packing oil and took some effort to clean. The four handles are rough and required fifteen minutes of hand sanding each to remove the “snags” that would catch on your hands. One handle has a crack two inches long and looks to be about half the handle diameter deep.
customer_reviews.author: Carol stagge

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay together
customer_reviews.text: It was in pieces and when assembled, didn't seem to stay in place like other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great axe
customer_reviews.text: Really nice axes although the blades weren’t on the handle properly and flew off I fixed them so all good now
customer_reviews.author: jason pennington

customer_reviews.title: Head falls off.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda sucks for a throwing ax. If you don’t stick it then the head falls off. I’ve tried everything, including putting a screw in it to keep the head in place. The screw broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today, huge ugly wield that looks questionable at best holding the head to the eye. Took it out side and gave it a go. After the 4th swing it stuck in the wood a little, a quick tug and the axe head slid right off the handle..RIGHT OFF THE HANDLE. How poorly do you have to make a hatchet that the head slides off the handle on day 1?
customer_reviews.author: Phil T.

customer_reviews.title: Great throwing axe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect throwing axe. Easy to use and very durable. Thousands of throws and works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Multisport

customer_reviews.title: Handle is not a good fit to the head.
customer_reviews.text: Throws well but after awhile the handle the handle got so bad (because it didn't fit hawk very well) I replaced it with a new handle, the replacement handle fits a little better but not perfect. For the price there is better quality hawks available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ka-thunk
customer_reviews.text: So far, the axe head has come loose after 10 throws, and one of the handles is very "sharp" bass rounded for grip. They fly true though, and are a lot of fun. I may make my own handle, but got alot of fun out of them already. Would recommend a cord grip (550/paracord).
customer_reviews.author: DDD

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the money nice hawk
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad of a hand Forged axe throws well will buy more thanks
customer_reviews.author: bryan scanlon

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Fun
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, sturdy product. I got it for my fiance and it is very funny to throw, he also enjoyed etching a design into the handle. Good quality and exactly as described by vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This is well balanced and easy to throw accurately from the first throw. I'm sure I'll add another one to my arsenal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have many camp or small axes but this one has become a favorite. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great axes!
customer_reviews.text: 3rd axe I bought from you guys. I love em. First two I got a couple of years ago and have used and abused them, they still look the same as the day I got em. After having the raw steel and the gun barrel blue (my favorite), I decided to buy the chrome axe head to complete the trio.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mccallum

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy this piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Can I give this zero stars? Don’t waste your time or money. I thought I’d give this hawk a try based on the description. It’s a piece of junk which I just returned. Amazon should stop the seller from allowing false advertising!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I never do reviews but this thing sucks. You can see the welds. It doesn’t sit on the handle good at all. I’m not sure if it’s the eye or handle but it points down and to the side a few degrees. I use tomahawk all the time I have had about 4 over the years and I’m really thinking about just throwing this away
customer_reviews.author: amy k.

customer_reviews.title: loose
customer_reviews.text: handle hole in hear is a little to big in both so handle will slide half way off
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K Cottman.

customer_reviews.title: sucks
customer_reviews.text: this thing sucks the head does not stay on the handle so have to make or find wedges to keed the head from falling off
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Culver

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my husband wanted. I love that the handles are replaceable!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Look seriously at theses
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for use at my house when the teenage grandkids come to visit. These are well balanced and stick easy right out of the box. Ok I admit I've had a lot of fun with them too.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Slim handles?
customer_reviews.text: Love the throwing tomahawks. Unfortunately one of the handles did not fit properly and did not allow for any excess handle at the top. I installed a wedge but that did not help much so had to order two extra handles to hopefully get a proper fit. Tomahawk axe heads are well crafted!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason P Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: The handle looks like hickory but has a lot of tiny splinters that ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears the cheek/blade was rather hastily welded to the butt/eye piece and ground in similar quality. The bit is soft and the edge blunt (almost a 90 degree angle). The handle looks like hickory but has a lot of tiny splinters that won't sand off (unlike good american hickory). The handle seats fairly well into the eye out of the box and with a little scraping it makes a decent fit. My opinion is it's overpriced by about $5-10 (and that doesn't include shipping).
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wood handle broke easily. Handle cracked. Needs harder wood options.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Also a quick hints page on how to throw wouldn't be a bad idea either
customer_reviews.text: For people who aren't familiar with axes some instruction would be helpful on how the hang the head properly. Also a quick hints page on how to throw wouldn't be a bad idea either. My only real complaint is how rough the head looks. The forging marks are very prominent and almost looks like it wasn't finished. Aesthetics aside, solid thrower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Casting had crack at a bad spot, returned it got back new head with ...
customer_reviews.text: Casting had crack at a bad spot, returned it got back new head with no handle, had to buy handle
customer_reviews.author: havanajohn

customer_reviews.title: Great tomahawk with alittle work.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tomahawk for the money. It does come very dull and the handle fitment is alittle off. But with 20 minutes and alittle elbow grease all of that can be fixed. I would definitely recommend this tomahawk if your comfortable with sharpening and handle modification.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Solid throwing axe.
customer_reviews.text: Basic throwing axe. friction fit (which i prefer). Pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: Shamus

customer_reviews.title: I received it on time I liked it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I received it on time I liked it a lot, it was very dull but sharpened up well with a file and stone, haven't tried to throw it wet, but it should do ok for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: George Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Havent thrown it yet but seems to be fine.Will have to sharpen a bit
customer_reviews.author: Jamie T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the quality and the heft of this throwing axe- will definitely be ordering one or two more
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid simple axe
customer_reviews.text: I've recently started throwing competively (limited in my area to be sure) This is my current favorite axe. Well made, sturdy and has taken a lot of throws. I did have to sand the handle to fit but overall I'm very happy with this. Sharpens well, and keeps a decent edge for repeated throws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade not finished or sharp
customer_reviews.text: Blade not finished. Blade not hardened. Had to clean and finish it myself . Then harden it myself .
customer_reviews.author: howard nelson jr

customer_reviews.title: Rip-off/poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolute trash. Poor quality. I ordered 3 and two of them the ax head had fallen off in shipping. For $40 a piece, they should be in working order. Very dull/rounded edge as well.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality but some of the forge hammer marks was left on the cutting edge other than that I'm pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I am impressed with the info ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am impressed with the info you sent on how many paces to step off before throwing. Also the the quality of the hawk as well. I use to throw hawks when I was a lot younger and wanted to start again. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad.
customer_reviews.text: the head itself is great but the handle broke on the first throw and the replacements i got from another company hold up much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Sir J

customer_reviews.title: Recipient loves this tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: Metal was loose on the shaft and had to be adjusted. The axe head looks rustic as is it were made long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G

customer_reviews.title: looks good well made
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Hawk yesterday. It can't hit the target, must be defective. Ha, just kidding, looks good well made. Hopefully one day I can hit the target.
customer_reviews.author: larry pierce

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend this axe was not happy at all with quality
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Dennis

customer_reviews.title: The axe head didn't come fitted with handle.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this item. I don't know why the head and handle weren't already fitted. Really frustrating. Wood seems cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tadd Maas

customer_reviews.title: Great fun to throw
customer_reviews.text: Great fun to throw. Needs frequent sharpening but overall a very good throwing hawk. A bit heavy for younger kids, but my 12 year old has no problem throwing it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyHat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The blade is not shapened as it mentions on the description
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This is crap! Ordered for my husband for Valentine’s Day. Got it and it’s just threw in a box and the blade is taped up with some cardboard. Looks awful cheap!!
customer_reviews.author: Brookie Mullins

customer_reviews.title: I really like them I ordered 3 they are great I did ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like them I ordered 3 they are great I did a little work on the handles to make them all the same length and sanded them a bit but it is exactly as advised
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: Hawk arrived very sharp, love the shape and taper of the handle, first throw was at 12 paces, stuck deep, very well balanced and the head is beautiful excellent craftsmanship..
customer_reviews.author: David dillon sharp

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ax
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son in law and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Snider

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice. The only downside is for between handle and head requires some finishing to get it right
customer_reviews.author: Lil torrey

customer_reviews.title: For $50, there should at least be a PLASTIC ...
customer_reviews.text: For $50, there should at least be a PLASTIC (cheap) sheath for safety. Also blade is not tight on handle and needs to be sharpened with a grinding wheel. Not worth $50, 100% overpriced
customer_reviews.author: BackPacker

customer_reviews.title: Throwing axe!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product should have been sharp! When you order a throwing axe the fist thing you want to do is throw it, not spend time sharpening it!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Throwing with style.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a buddy who was very very pleased with the quality and balance of this hawk. After seeing it up close I think I may buy a few for myself to play around with. Thanks for the great craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Derry Jr

customer_reviews.title: Pure crap
customer_reviews.text: Not balanced well, every single axe I bought,3 of them, none of them had a sharpened edge or any dge for that matter.looked lIke they been sloppily made. I had to grind all the edge with a Bencheck grinder in order for them to be sharp enough to stay in the wood. Absolutely horrible quality for the amount I paid for them. Please save you money and don't buy from this seller.. only pros, it's a gravity head so there aren't any nails so easier to switch out the handles steel is decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: i didnt get the color i wanted but its whatever now as i cant get a refund cuz its been 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: used this axe for throwing i have to sharpen it myself which is bad for someone who doesnet own any sharpening tool but i guess its a safety thing
customer_reviews.author: Dan Marius Eikhom

customer_reviews.title: Not a winning edge...
customer_reviews.text: Little to no edge, bought two axes and literally one edge is completely flat. Won’t be winning any throwing competitions anytime soon with these...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit thinking about it and order one (two is even better)
customer_reviews.text: Well made, well balanced and a BLAST to throw. I taught my wife to throw using a pair of these I recently purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome son loved it, awesome and light for throwing, he never missed after throwing 10 times
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Easy Thrower
customer_reviews.text: Tough, great quality, I should have bought more and am kicking myself I didn't start doing this 25 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: TheBiggsy

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: I love it has come in handy a few times. Also just fun to have
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: They are ok
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two different head types but the were basically the same but other than that they are decent enough quality

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Ready too throw right out of the package . Nice weight , good balance .
customer_reviews.author: L E K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you'd like to discover how awful you are at throwing axes. 10/10 would fail again.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 8 of these hatchets for a tournament of ours and they met my expectations. Great product. I burned them down with a torch and added some grip tape. Very balanced and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Axe head doesn't fit handle property. You'll have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Axe head doesn't fit handle property. You'll have to file it and the handle down! There's a weld inside the axe head preventing it to sit probably on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great for hatchet wounds.
customer_reviews.text: Looking to feel more manly? Want to throw hatchets at posters of hatchet wounds? Look no further?
customer_reviews.author: Chase Tanner

product_meta.title: Throwing Axe - Win Your Next Viking Throwing Tomahawk Competition! 19" Hand Forged Hatchet from High Carbon Steel, NMLRA Approved, 100% Guaranteed from Defects
feature_bullets: READY TO WIN YOUR NEXT THROWING COMPETITION? EQUIP YOURSELF WITH THE BEST -If you're a serious competitor, then you know in order to be the best you've got to have the best equipment. You're looking at the premier competition throwing axe on Amazon.

COMPETITION THROWING TOMAHAWK...BEST BALANCED 19" HATCHET FOR THROWERS -We've got the best blacksmith in the business who still forges these hawks by hand one-by-one. We then seat it with a premium A grade straight grain American Hickory hard wood handle; giving you unbeatable control and long-lasting durability & performance.

BALANCED, PRECISE, DURABLE, QUALITY CONSTRUCTION. YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED! -Weighing only 1.6lbs and having the perfect 3.75" blade edge allows you to impress your friends or battle competitors and experience your best throwing ever!

IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT OUR DESIGN - We use a friction fit system to secure the axe head to the handle. This means the axe head may separate from handle on bad impace. This is NORMAL. See description or product images for instructions to reinstall
NEED SPARE HANDLES OR A SHEATH AS WELL? Spare Handles can be found typing in ASIN B00B40GFWM or B00HN25IDC - Sheaths using ASIN - B00K85OENG or B00H85S7UK
